page.title: 19World War 2 Relics - Well
page.content: Well Vale Estate was used by the Army during the War as an Ammunition Dump. The evidence of Mr.Hilton, father of a present member of staff at the Grammar School, who was stationed at Bilsby from December 1942 until early 1943, indicates that it was used to supply surrounding gun sites. There were several units there at that time, comprising 3 batteries of 24 Field Regiment, in transit to N.Africa and 8th. Army. Mr. Hilton was a signaller and detached from the Royal Worcester Regiment for use by No.1 Battery. They left in early 1943 for N.Africa. Later in the war the camp became a prisoner- of-war camp. There is little physical evidence of the occupation, the Army having withdrawn by 1950. All that can be found are the camp front steps, some building bases and concrete roads.
